title: Resolve Airspace iusse to full integrate OpenGL inside WPF
body:
There are many programmers and company that develop applications based on geometrical kernels that use OpenGL for drawing (like CAD/CAM applications) often they have an old MFC application, and to pass to a modern view for their applications and give a new user experience for the user they could make new WPF interfaces very quickly but they can't rewrite an entire kernel to pass from OpenGL to DirectX, so often they prefer to remain with MFC without pass to WPF. This could be a very special thing to have the possibility to use OpenGL fully supported by WPF, without airspace iusse.
Now it's possible the integration using HwndHost or WindowsFormsHost but it's not possible to have other WPF control over this, and it's impossible to apply effects and transitions.
